skill.name: skill-developer
skill.description: Create and manage Claude Code skills with auto-activation, progressive disclosure, and memory patterns. Use when creating skills, modifying skill-rules.json, understanding triggers (keywords, intent, file, content), working with hooks (UserPromptSubmit, PreToolUse, Stop), debugging activation, implementing guardrails, or building memory-aware skills that persist context across sessions. Covers 500-line rule, session tracking, enforcement levels (block, suggest, warn), plan-approval workflows, and best practices.
skill.summary: Create and manage Claude Code skills with auto-activation, progressive disclosure, and memory patter...
skill.author: DojoCodingLabs

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing no executable code, no network calls, and no file system access beyond its own directory. All content is markdown documentation teaching users how to create skills. Static scanner flagged 524 findings but all are false positives triggered by code examples in documentation, not actual security vulnerabilities.

content.user_title: Create Claude Code Skills with Auto-Activation
content.value_statement: Claude Code skills provide intelligent, context-aware guidance that activates automatically based on your work. This guide teaches you to build skills with triggers, hooks, and memory patterns for specialized assistance.
actual_capabilities: Create skills with keyword, intent, file path, and content triggers
Configure auto-activation based on prompts and file edits
Implement guardrails with block, suggest, and warn enforcement levels
Build memory-aware skills that persist user preferences across sessions
Debug skill activation issues with testing commands
limitations: Does not execute code - provides documentation only
Requires Claude Code environment to use skills
Skills must follow the 500-line rule for main SKILL.md file

use_cases.title: Build custom skill plugins
use_cases.description: Create skills that provide domain-specific guidance for your team with auto-activation based on context

use_cases.title: Enforce coding standards
use_cases.description: Create guardrail skills that prevent common mistakes and ensure best practices are followed automatically

use_cases.title: Personalize Claude behavior
use_cases.description: Build memory-aware skills that learn your preferences and adapt to your workflow over time

prompt_templates.title: Create basic skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create a new skill called database-verification that reminds me to check table names before writing Prisma queries

prompt_templates.title: Add trigger patterns
prompt_templates.prompt: Add keyword and file path triggers to my skill so it activates when editing files in the backend directory

prompt_templates.title: Implement guardrail
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a guardrail skill that blocks edits until the user verifies database schema changes

prompt_templates.title: Add memory patterns
prompt_templates.prompt: Add memory patterns to my skill so it remembers when I correct column naming conventions

output_examples.input: Help me create a guardrail skill that prevents me from committing without tests
output: Added to skill-rules.json with enforcement: block

output_examples.input: How do I make a skill activate when I work on frontend files
output: Configure file path triggers using glob patterns like src/components/**/*
Set enforcement level to suggest for guidance skills

output_examples.input: Create a skill that remembers my preference for camelCase column names
output: Implement memory refresh triggers based on file edits

best_practices: Keep SKILL.md under 500 lines and use reference files for detailed topics
Test all trigger patterns with real examples before deploying skills
Use session tracking to prevent repeated interruptions in the same session
anti_patterns: Using overly generic keywords that trigger on unrelated prompts
Making intent patterns too broad causing false positive activations
Forgetting to add file exclusions for test and spec files

faq.question: What are the different enforcement levels?
faq.answer: Suggest shows guidance but allows all actions. Block prevents execution until skill is used. Warn provides low-priority hints.

faq.question: What triggers can I use for skill activation?
faq.answer: Keywords match text in prompts. Intent patterns use regex to detect actions. File path patterns match file locations. Content patterns match code in files.

faq.question: How do I test if my skill activates correctly?
faq.answer: Use echo with JSON payload piped to tsx for testing UserPromptSubmit triggers. Test PreToolUse with tool input simulation.

faq.question: Is data stored by memory-aware skills secure?
faq.answer: Skills should never store credentials or API keys. User preferences and project patterns are safe to persist in .claude/memory/.

faq.question: Why is my skill not triggering?
faq.answer: Check JSON syntax with jq. Verify keywords match your prompt. Ensure skill name matches in both SKILL.md and skill-rules.json.

faq.question: How is this different from Claude's built-in tools?
faq.answer: Built-in tools are general purpose. Skills provide specialized context for specific domains with auto-activation based on your work context.
